title: Marinades: Myth vs. Science
description: A 60-second lesson on Marinades: Myth vs. Science.

hook.text: Recipes say to marinate chicken overnight for deep flavor. Science says it barely penetrates 2mm.

buildup.text: Marinade molecules are too large to move deep into dense muscle tissue quickly.

discovery.text: Acid in marinades denatures surface proteins, changing texture â€” but doesn't 'infuse' flavor deeply.

twist.text: Too much acid or time makes the surface mushy. Over-marinated fish turns chalky, like ceviche.

climax.text: Salt is the exception â€” it's tiny enough to penetrate deeply. Brining works; marinades mostly don't.

punchline.text: Marinades flavor the surface. Salt flavors the whole.

quiz.question: Why do most marinades fail to deeply flavor meat?
options: Molecules are too large to penetrate
